bCSWAx-s6.memHandModelNotes: Generally distributed between 610-1220m in TN, but have recorded singing males as low as 550m on Cumberland Plateau (Nicholson 1997).  Richardson & Brauning (1995) restricts species to elevations >450m in Appalachian mountians. ****Do not restrict Montane Forest, Disturbed successional shrub/scrub, natural scrub/shrub, or Bald-shrub ecosystems to Edge Buffer. So only apply edge buffer to Mixed, & Hardwood Forests, Developed open space, pasture or succ grassland (identified as AMU's). Ecotone width derived from territorial spacing, larger male territory size 1.10 ha (Richardson & Brauning 1995)…1.10ha=11000m^2=104m so 60m buffer from & into forest gives 120m edge.  Amy Silvano 6jun05
